Senior
Special Diet: Consider switching to a senior cat food formulated to support aging bodies and address potential health concerns. 
Mobility Support: Provide easy access to comfortable resting spots and consider ramps or steps for easier mobility. 
Regular Checkups: Increase the frequency of vet checkups to monitor for age-related health issues such as arthritis, kidney disease, or dental problems. 
Quality Time: Spend quality time with your senior cat, providing gentle exercise and attention tailored to their needs.

Geriatric
Focus on providing a comfortable environment with easy access to food, water, litter box, and cozy resting areas. 
Pain Management: Monitor for signs of pain or discomfort and work with your vet to manage any age-related ailments. 
Nutritional Support: Consider supplements or specialized diets to address specific health concerns such as joint health or cognitive function. 
Love and Attention: Shower your geriatric cat with love and attention, ensuring they feel secure and cherished in their golden years.
